elements.2211.03248_a161fb6e1698ddaf3e738ad17ab43: The horseshoe prior is known to possess many desirable properties for Bayesian estimation of sparse parameter vectors, yet its density function lacks an analytic form
elements.2211.03248_39774394b776d5d87e0a7696c1205: As such, it is challenging to find a closed-form solution for the posterior mode
elements.2211.03248_849b43efd6a93011da4e00cbe50fb: Conventional horseshoe estimators use the posterior mean to estimate the parameters, but these estimates are not sparse
elements.2211.03248_242fa63e7605b727ba2223b4fbfc7: We propose a novel expectation-maximisation (EM) procedure for computing the MAP estimates of the parameters in the case of the standard linear model
elements.2211.03248_ac0ac16c4e4d642f49c84a63a805f: A particular strength of our approach is that the M-step depends only on the form of the prior and it is independent of the form of the likelihood
elements.2211.03248_a4e1ee1931bd9dca33b4278e39d6f: We introduce several simple modifications of this EM procedure that allow for straightforward extension to generalised linear models
elements.2211.03248_6a4fdda48cac621926bc67db64dfb: In experiments performed on simulated and real data, our approach performs comparable, or superior to, state-of-the-art sparse estimation methods in terms of statistical performance and computational cost.
elements.2211.03248_53ffa355b4909ba2c76060df17d63: Sparse modelling has become increasingly important in statistical learning due to the growing demand for the analysis of high dimensional data with parameters whose dimension exceeds the sample size
elements.2211.03248_372a0bab094172bc2b273aa034c70: Inference under such a setting often involves the assumption that the parameter vector is sparse
elements.2211.03248_dcf7c92c6d8d1e5a4639ba26a1986: This implies that most of the components in the vector are insignificant and should be removed to achieve a good estimate
elements.2211.03248_1193b938ae5ba4c4907459ac0733e: is a popular sparsity inducing technique well-known for its ability to simultaneously perform variable selection and coefficient estimation
elements.2211.03248_8630bd2d3ec5980614a018ff3063b: The lasso is a convex penalisation technique, and is known to suffer from over-shrinkage and consistency issues
elements.2211.03248_3254ae21ceea6145dd1136e7a9d1c: ; to combat these, authors introduced non-convex penalty to replace the usual
elements.2211.03248_6599ab6c942299a163018502f6100: Well-known non-convex penalties include the smoothly clipped absolute deviation (SCAD)
elements.2211.03248_08344c48a504560b857aaeb1891d3: However, these approaches are all frequentist in nature, usually relying on an additional principle such as cross-validation to select the degree of regularisation, and do not have immediate access to reliable measures of uncertainty to complement the point estimates they produce
elements.2211.03248_a4867a32c7d5fe7a1f48cbc39caef: Bayesian inference, on the other hand, naturally quantifies uncertainty directly through the posterior distribution
elements.2211.03248_0ee7c70ef266d2801f13c9e03ea34: Bayesian penalised regression offers readily available uncertainty estimates, automatic estimation of the penalty parameters, and more flexibility in terms of penalties that can be considered
elements.2211.03248_dffc76e0a8db96ad2e6c593337a79: In this paper, we consider the standard Gaussian linear regression model
elements.2211.03248_33f23f884ac6667f770cd11fb5563: is a vector of outcome variable,
elements.2211.03248_eefef593570987af1f77045a42503: is a matrix of predictor variables,
elements.2211.03248_9008d12f830be5a7bf749a7d5fcdf: is a vector of i.i.d. normally distributed random error with mean zero and unknown variance
elements.2211.03248_a361c53a5696a40b42142926a445b: , our goal is to accurately identify and estimate the non-zero components of the unknown regression coefficients
elements.2211.03248_75eaca8c26d8023ea815602e3db03: Most penalised regression methods can be solved in the Bayesian framework by interpreting the estimates of
elements.2211.03248_b5882907a3a1ad7fb51057e83d32f: as the posterior point estimate of choice under an appropriate prior distribution
elements.2211.03248_272db34eddae2c92b345707486794: For example, the lasso estimate can be interpreted as posterior mode estimates when the regression parameters
elements.2211.03248_c7f779893a061a24b253b9c3080f5: follow an independent and identical double exponential (Laplace) prior
elements.2211.03248_bda4c327a28312aea6ed5709e5836: Motivated by this relationship, much work has been done in proposing different Bayesian approaches to the sparse estimation problem via a variety of sparsity inducing priors
elements.2211.03248_b8a0a088fa34a1987265019fd1b45: Some popular examples include the Bayesian Lasso
elements.2211.03248_708298547a4b53f0d4235efaa17ca: These estimators are frequently implemented using Monte Carlo Markov Chain (MCMC) algorithms to sample from the posterior distribution, and the resulting Bayesian estimates are usually posterior means or medians.
elements.2211.03248_2bc56b846a2c38b5bbe93a0885671: Interestingly, however, while these priors may be sparsity promoting, in the sense that they concentrate probability mass around sparse coefficient vectors, the resulting posterior means or medians will never themselves be sparse
elements.2211.03248_c8bd7dedcf8387a62c072f90daf89: Sparse estimates can be achieved by instead considering the posterior mode, i.e., maximum a posteriori (MAP) estimation
elements.2211.03248_dfc49e784f4d365221138523384c4: Unfortunately, most implementations of Bayesian MAP-based sparse estimators are not flexible in the sense that they only work for linear models when paired with a specified prior
elements.2211.03248_22c346c8988dbfbacc939e1567acd: These methods do not easily generalise to other regression models and are difficult to apply to priors that lack an analytic form (e.g., horseshoe prior, Strawderman-Berger prior and normal-Gamma prior)
elements.2211.03248_99405382816efb0736d6df76d5c45: ) rules for the posterior mean or median of
elements.2211.03248_a8e17bb7635cd144f7bf035b047c8: s can be used to produce sparse estimates, but these tend to lack theoretical justification, and inference can be highly sensitive to the choice of the threshold
elements.2211.03248_d8fd6965ba88d4a61b51b6e074971: we propose a novel expectation-maximisation (EM) procedure to solve for the
elements.2211.03248_92f5647592f52dccc80bbd2be60c5: posterior mode of a regression model under the horseshoe prior;
elements.2211.03248_f1dc0a8980e059083b8890f940743: we introduce several simple modifications of our base EM procedure that allow for straightforward extension to models beyond the usual Gaussian linear model, e.g., generalised linear models.
elements.2211.03248_8d7c79ba6d50ca7797c7526ac521c: Experiments on simulated data and real datasets in Section
elements.2211.03248_7da408346093f199cb3518da4a111: demonstrate that our proposed Bayesian EM sparse horseshoe estimator can give comparable, if not better, performance when compared to state-of-the-art non-convex solvers in terms of statistical performance and computational cost
elements.2211.03248_9e66b43bdfad4ac60c8bb03e55f6d: As far as the authors are aware, this is the first work that explores the posterior mode under the exact representation of the horseshoe prior, instead of using an approximated density function in place of the horseshoe prior.
elements.2211.03248_4d8c41c5d5083431e9cb364d333c9: is one of the most widely used methods for MAP estimation of sparse Bayesian linear models, with
elements.2211.03248_fb378d3f3d1ba3a8ebe9137cfe9ac: being classic papers on this approach
elements.2211.03248_96bca5edb9f06b8fdb1c3e04b38a8: A particular strength, in comparison to approximate methods such as variational Bayes
elements.2211.03248_2f5b362a1dcb88991013e55c72e76: , is that it is guaranteed to converge to exact posterior modes (a stationary point in the likelihood) whenever it can be applied
elements.2211.03248_b592265773ac65288f30e46a328d2: By introducing appropriate latent variables, the hierarchical decomposition of the Laplace prior allows
elements.2211.03248_587b6854b6db88c464517c552a565: for the derivation of an efficient EM algorithm to recover the lasso estimates
elements.2211.03248_75f5d63cc5d27145fcaec17959217: Following this work, many authors have attempted similar procedure to achieve sparse estimation using various priors and likelihood models that admit a scale mixture of normals (SMN) representation
elements.2211.03248_35570cd983ea62f4274c1aac62356: In this paper, we focus on the class of global-local shrinkage priors
elements.2211.03248_10a0137134f02b6e702f07fc703a0: , and more specifically the horseshoe prior, which has been recognised as a good default prior choice for Bayesian sparse estimation
elements.2211.03248_4be1829c4dbb3b49181dc6af75895: The horseshoe prior has a pole at
elements.2211.03248_787d8c7f760588452f489f8b7478a: These properties are desirable in sparse estimation because they allow small coefficients to be heavily shrunk towards zero while ensuring large coefficients are not over-shrunk
elements.2211.03248_3af220153b1a9c6de6815176df24c: This is in contrast to the popular Bayesian lasso and Bayesian ridge hierarchies that apply the same amount of shrinkage to all coefficients and potentially over-shrink coefficients that are far from zero

elements.2211.03248_1a9f3fba28b7a9ccb818c2a82dad7: A GLM models the conditional mean of the target by an appropriate (potentially) non-linear transformation of the linear predictor; well known examples include binomial logistic regression and Poisson log-linear regression

elements.2211.03248_841c76ad2bb997dfff9755d53203f: We compare the performance of our proposed EM-based horseshoe estimator (HS-EM, using the exact expectations, and HS-apx, using the approximate expectations) against several state-of-the-art sparse methods including non-convex estimators (SCAD, MCP, HS-like estimator
elements.2211.03248_229c3afce6a12692343712ae9dd8b: We analyse the performance of the estimators in terms of variables selected and prediction accuracy on both simulated and real data
elements.2211.03248_e42846f732e4f47f8fed939646674: The experiments in this section are designed for variable selection under high dimensional settings, and we use the following metrics:
elements.2211.03248_9b8bb5740b7a9117b9cf99ca255a0: Mean squared prediction error; given by

elements.2211.03248_e15c3e904327c998f4dbd4986bbc2: The results are shown in Table
elements.2211.03248_93a60ed3545bc2e620ddd61d81fa8: Overall, the HS-like estimator performed the best, obtaining the lowest MSE at the expense of substantial overfitting
elements.2211.03248_314d365a7b4888f1da62b31e68d44: The good performance in MSE under this setting is not unexpected, as this problem setting favors estimators that overfit (i.e., are less conservative) to a certain extent
elements.2211.03248_b1ac681e0693ae5aff321dde1bad7: Given a sparse vector with only 20 non-zero coefficients, this setting in which all non-zero coefficients have the same magnitude is one of the hardest settings for a sparse method, as excluding any one of the true coefficients is equally damaging
elements.2211.03248_3984f2b9c2574de175ffd242318a1: The prediction risk of this problem is
elements.2211.03248_42dac0c10ecbc6a4fccf9e207bcb0: ; if a method incorrectly includes an irrelevant predictor in the model, the risk will approximately be the variance of the estimate associated with this variable, i.e.,
elements.2211.03248_02f33f63b86a262d057e4442a119d: ; in contrast, incorrectly excluding non-zero predictors will incur an error of
elements.2211.03248_b660145fb25970580d040985fc5b8: even for the setting of greater noise, i.e.,
elements.2211.03248_7a88e5930566b2db1126dd080b045: In general, approximately half of the coefficients included in the HS-like model are false non-zeros (FNZ); while most of the coefficients included in our HS models are true non-zeros with consistent small difference between TNZ and No.V.
elements.2211.03248_f21469e9977725173de61b878d661: The HS-EM, SCAD and MCP methods all generally select much fewer variables than the HS-like estimator, with the HS-EM method overfitting less than HS-like and underfitting more than MCP or SCAD
elements.2211.03248_c17b55a13ae05d30650d910bb98de: In terms of MSE, our HS-EM method is competitive with, or superior to SCAD and MCP for all settings, despite producing substantially sparser estimates
elements.2211.03248_76b3dc026f61d45dd70b475f4f67f: It appears that both SCAD and MCP are sensitive to the correlation structure of the data; their performance is comparable to our HS-EM approach when there is no correlation, but when correlation is introduced to the data, both methods performed substantially worse in terms of MSE
elements.2211.03248_187f8b1347a458301c3130df272bb: Such behaviour is not observed in our proposed HS estimator
elements.2211.03248_468635cbeff948fc6bbee858d3bc0: Of the two proposed HS estimators, HS-apx appears to be approximately three times faster than HS-EM
elements.2211.03248_0208fad47307fb052045ee019e272: Otherwise, both estimators give roughly similar performance.
elements.2211.03248_23a6922b372e3909e8561a49ca50e: We further analyse the performance of our proposed method on six real-world datasets
elements.2211.03248_eefb5f3663b9c04b2e531998c6527: All datasets are available for download from the UCI machine learning repository
elements.2211.03248_da0941f2bf67a0217f6868d35167e: Each dataset is randomly split such that the training data has a sample size of
elements.2211.03248_7b95cd1992ac3829a5972438f4489: This procedure is repeated 50 times and the averaged summary statistics for the performance measures are presented in Tables
elements.2211.03248_86eda2bd0f7dff6b8786320a59b76: for the linear regression and logistic regression experiments, respectively.
elements.2211.03248_1845d93012e52a811968481ae749b: presents the posterior mean estimates and their 95
elements.2211.03248_35e8f3b06028ef69ff8a5f0211b34: credible intervals (CI) for the diabetes data
elements.2211.03248_2db0954d06fbb490da8c8b0a01395: For comparison, we included the posterior mode estimates computed from the proposed HS-EM estimator
elements.2211.03248_6b79dd2b19e17e541efcbfd1658c6: The HS-EM posterior mode estimates are very similar to the corresponding posterior means, and all posterior mode estimates are within the corresponding
elements.2211.03248_cab3dee7a71a1c639efca63266280: credible intervals; however, the HS-EM posterior mode provides a sparse point estimate as it excludes all variables (except S3) with 95
elements.2211.03248_a95304034e0334471631561cb7262: In addition to the diabetes data, we also analysed the benchmark Boston housing data (
elements.2211.03248_68ca29323febde510c98b219f18f6: To make the problem more difficult, for each dataset we added a number of noise variables generated using the same procedure described in Section
elements.2211.03248_4e3cff59501a07d7cad4412ed7420: Model fitting is done using all the
elements.2211.03248_72777658f3cfad9ef24420ba7cc63: (original plus noise) predictors as well as all interactions and possible transformations of the variables (logs, squares and cubics).
elements.2211.03248_7f48ac0defc88a3ceaec7ef6cac97: Overall, our proposed HS estimator performs the best, attaining the lowest MSE on all real data, while generally selecting the simplest models (included the lowest number of variables)
elements.2211.03248_a93b0625850e4b337cb15fa164197: Similar to the results observed in Section
elements.2211.03248_b7ea08f271e15fd145cd426e9eb0d: , the results for HS-apx are virtually identical to the exact HS-EM procedure, while being substantially faster
elements.2211.03248_4752fe7420c4bba6fc11df5f124db: SCAD and MCP exhibit comparable performance to HS in terms of prediction error for the diabetes data and eye data, but have relatively poor performance for Boston and concrete data
elements.2211.03248_627400599cb037f6bb3b1e7a56f27: Interestingly, while HS-like dominated the other non-convex estimators in terms of MSE on the simulated experiments, it performs quite poorly on the real data analysis, particularly on the diabetes and Boston housing data
elements.2211.03248_2d9622119177611625953e963a5ae: The HS-like estimator tended to include the highest number of variables, suggesting it is potentially prone to overfitting as discussed in Section
elements.2211.03248_f7dc81acc26bd12fa525dcb3d9ad4: Ridge regression generally performs worse than the sparse estimators, as would be expected given the experimental design.
elements.2211.03248_de8ae11cd25bad6630608e7fabe89: We also tested the HS-EM estimator on two binary classification problems: the Pima indians data (
elements.2211.03248_b851382d394ba1c0ab12cd4f91e7c: Similar to the linear regression analysis, we augment the data with 10 noise variables and model the predictors together with their interactions and transformations
elements.2211.03248_9c1b01a767233308eac56c6ca2da7: For the heart disease data, we only included the interactions between the variables and not the transformations, as there were a substantial number of categorical predictors
elements.2211.03248_6cb24c47702fe9599a89eb3feca20: For this experiment we varied the number of training samples
elements.2211.03248_221dfb024f5a1095bba83adc62be6: The HS-EM estimator obtains the best classification accuracy and negative log-loss on the Pima data for both training sample sizes
elements.2211.03248_a882609cd812ad368444ba49428d4: Ridge regression, on the other hand, performs the best in terms of classification accuracy for the heart data
elements.2211.03248_e059bf8e271805674b55eaf4a13c4: This suggest that many of the predictors and interactions between the variables in the heart data are potentially correlated with the response variable
elements.2211.03248_b310babc7b4b241e4e5e0dda89c21: Therefore, a sparse estimator might not be suitable for modelling this data
elements.2211.03248_fe86821a2ce844052e927bbb06b9d: Nonetheless, our HS methods gives comparable results to the other sparse methods in terms of log-loss and in general, as the sample size increases, the difference in performance between all estimators becomes less significant.
elements.2211.03248_10469e708f94f38c73f52e747f663: In this paper we introduced a novel EM algorithm that allows us to efficiently find, for the first time, the exact, sparse posterior mode of the horseshoe estimator
elements.2211.03248_67a3ca6832e237dec8041a595d17d: The experimental results suggest that in comparison with state-of-the-art non-convex sparse estimators, the HS-EM estimator is quite robust to the underlying structure of the problem
elements.2211.03248_bf70a5d1cdb08ab748ff70fc29fbf: Both the MCP and SCAD algorithm appear sensitive to correlation in the predictors, and the HS-like estimator, based on an approximation to the horseshoe prior, appears sensitive to the signal-to-noise ratio of the problem
elements.2211.03248_ef70bf78adc5702b556065d31b765: In contrast, the HS-EM algorithm, even when not performing the best, appears to always remain competitive with the best performing method while selecting highly sparse models
elements.2211.03248_444ef7dd45e0a4d4e3013992b0dfc: Comparing the shrinkage profiles of the HS and HS-like estimator (see Figure
elements.2211.03248_ab92d5b8fe18e860a58762edfe143: ), the mixed performance of the HS-like procedure, is possibly due to the fact that HS-like approach more aggressively zeros out coefficients, making it more sensitive to misspecification of the global shrinkage parameter
elements.2211.03248_80368c3e70a5e3b0ef2049a0cc9bd: We also conjecture that the conventional EM framework, in which the shrinkage hyperparameters
elements.2211.03248_dd11ffc7589d4806fee43b2ccbec5: are treated as missing data, provides a poorer basis for estimation of the global hyperparameter, in comparison to our approach of treating the coefficients as missing data, which potentially integrates the uncertainty of the parameters more effectively into the Q-function
elements.2211.03248_5bcc5101c5257f00e8c05a551d99d: This is a topic for further investigation.
elements.2211.03248_ac32bf224a126eedc80621821fd45: Due to its prior preference for dense models, ridge regression can perform much worse than sparse alternatives if the underlying problem is sparse
elements.2211.03248_2d2257d150888ccc0247ae9be831f: However, it remained competitive or superior to other sparse methods on several of the real datasets
elements.2211.03248_52e5b6f37304468941b8da0d1f73f: This strongly suggests that a method that is adaptive to the unknown degree of sparsity would be beneficial; we anticipate extending our algorithm to the generalised horseshoe discussed in Section
elements.2211.03248_9fad3cc004025f2fced14d475be09: , and automatically tuning our prior to produce a technique that will adapt to the sparsity of the problem.
elements.2211.03248_7f0977f2fc1ba852522321baf932f: While our HS-EM algorithm is able to locate, exactly, a sparse posterior mode of the horseshoe estimator, there is an obvious question as to what mode we are finding
elements.2211.03248_6d25b86b8244cb3417a12baab68ea: Posterior modes (and means) are not invariant under reparameterisation, which suggests that maximising for
elements.2211.03248_6cc61da1b9364c0cb7ef86b91949d: (with appropriate transformation of prior distribution) in place of
elements.2211.03248_c7c04048eb2b937f2e9778edc65e5: , for example, will produce a new shrinkage procedure with potentially different properties
elements.2211.03248_593e74fe47f86c2e9f02c09812bd2: This is a focus of future research
elements.2211.03248_b5a9ffc5528ce33a2c37a91217932: The EM algorithm in this paper can also be easily extended to other popular priors such as the Bayesian lasso
elements.2211.03248_b5790eea51f4ab2f10fa10cded20a: Finally, given the relative simplicity of the M-step updates in this framework, it is of interest to consider extensions to non-linear models, such as neural networks
elements.2211.03248_085bf7b038e18c9fef5dcbc890218: In this case, the required conditional expectations are unlikely to be available in closed form, but given access to a Gibbs sampler (or approximate Gibbs sampler) the procedure can easily be extended to utilise a standard stochastic EM implementation
elements.2211.03248_0f75a65f21ddc13a60fe36026f4ec: This could potentially provide a simple, and (in expectation) exact, alternative to variational Bayes for these problems.
